Deprecated API

Contents

  • Deprecated Packages
  • Deprecated Interfaces
  • Deprecated Fields
  • Deprecated Methods
  • Deprecated Packages 
    Package and Description
    co.cask.cdap.api.data
    As of CDAP 2.3.0, replaced by co.cask.cdap.api.dataset
  • Deprecated Interfaces 
    Interface and Description
    co.cask.cdap.api.dataset.table.OrderedTable
    since 2.8.0. Use Table instead.
  • Deprecated Fields 
    Field and Description
    co.cask.cdap.api.dataset.table.OrderedTable.PROPERTY_READLESS_INCREMENT
    since 2.8.0. Use Table.PROPERTY_READLESS_INCREMENT instead.
    co.cask.cdap.api.dataset.table.OrderedTable.PROPERTY_TTL
    since 2.8.0. Use Table.PROPERTY_TTL instead.
  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    co.cask.cdap.api.workflow.WorkflowAction.configure()
    Use AbstractWorkflowAction.configure(co.cask.cdap.api.workflow.WorkflowActionConfigurer) instead.
    co.cask.cdap.api.workflow.AbstractWorkflowAction.configure()
    co.cask.cdap.api.flow.AbstractFlow.configureFlow()
    (as of version 3.3.0) Use AbstractFlow.configure() instead.
    co.cask.cdap.api.schedule.Schedules.createDataSchedule(String, String, Schedules.Source, String, int)
    As of version 3.3.0, replaced by Schedules.builder(String).
    co.cask.cdap.api.schedule.Schedules.createTimeSchedule(String, String, String)
    As of version 3.3.0, replaced by Schedules.builder(String).
    co.cask.cdap.api.flow.FlowletDefinition.getDatasetModules()
    co.cask.cdap.api.flow.FlowletDefinition.getDatasetSpecs()
    co.cask.cdap.api.workflow.AbstractWorkflowAction.getDescription()
    Use AbstractWorkflowAction.setDescription(java.lang.String) instead
    co.cask.cdap.etl.api.batch.BatchRuntimeContext.getHadoopJob()
    this method will be removed.
    co.cask.cdap.etl.api.batch.BatchContext.getHadoopJob()
    this method will be removed.
    co.cask.cdap.api.service.http.HttpServiceRequest.getHeaders()
    Use HttpServiceRequest.getAllHeaders() instead. This method will be removed in future release.
    co.cask.cdap.api.workflow.WorkflowToken.getMapReduceCounters()
    As of release 3.1, MapReduce counters are now stored under the key counter group name, followed by ".", followed by the counter name.

    For example: to access the the number of input records to the map method of the ``PurchaseHistoryBuilder`` MapReduce program: 

     
 String counterGroupName = "org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.TaskCounter";
 String counterName = "MAP_INPUT_RECORDS";
 String counterKey = counterGroupName + "." + counterName;
 String counterValue = workflowToken.get(counterKey, "PurchaseHistoryBuilder", WorkflowToken.Scope.SYSTEM);

    Get the Hadoop counters from the previous MapReduce program in the Workflow. The method returns null if the counters are not set.
    co.cask.cdap.api.workflow.AbstractWorkflowAction.getName()
    Use AbstractWorkflowAction.setName(java.lang.String) instead
    co.cask.cdap.api.dataset.lib.PartitionConsumerResult.getPartitionIterator()
    Use PartitionConsumerResult.getPartitions() instead.
    co.cask.cdap.api.flow.FlowletDefinition.getStreams()
    co.cask.cdap.api.common.Bytes.immutableSortedMapOf(byte[], T)
    This method will be removed in future release
    co.cask.cdap.api.common.Bytes.immutableSortedMapOf(byte[], T, byte[], T)
    This method will be removed in future release
    co.cask.cdap.api.service.http.HttpServiceResponder.send(int, ByteBuffer, String, Multimap)
    Use HttpServiceResponder.send(int, ByteBuffer, String, Map) or HttpServiceResponder.send(int, ByteBuffer, String, Iterable) instead. This method will be removed in future release.
    co.cask.cdap.api.service.http.HttpServiceResponder.sendStatus(int, Multimap)
    Use HttpServiceResponder.sendStatus(int, Map) or HttpServiceResponder.sendStatus(int, Iterable) instead. This method will be removed in future release.
    co.cask.cdap.api.mapreduce.MapReduceContext.setInput(String, Dataset)
    as of version 3.3.0. Use MapReduceContext.setInput(String, Map) or MapReduceContext.setInput(InputFormatProvider) instead.
    co.cask.cdap.etl.api.batch.BatchSourceContext.setInput(String, Dataset)
    Deprecated since 3.3.0. Use BatchSourceContext.setInput(String, Map) or BatchSourceContext.setInput(InputFormatProvider) instead
    co.cask.cdap.api.mapreduce.MapReduceContext.setOutput(String)
    co.cask.cdap.api.mapreduce.MapReduceContext.setOutput(String, Dataset)
    co.cask.cdap.api.mapreduce.AbstractMapReduce.setOutputDataset(String)
    co.cask.cdap.api.worker.AbstractWorker.useDatasets(Iterable)
    datasets used in runtime need not be specified in Worker.configure(co.cask.cdap.api.worker.WorkerConfigurer)
    co.cask.cdap.api.worker.WorkerConfigurer.useDatasets(Iterable)
    datasets being used during runtime need not be specified in Worker.configure(co.cask.cdap.api.worker.WorkerConfigurer)
    co.cask.cdap.api.mapreduce.AbstractMapReduce.useDatasets(Iterable)
    datasets used in runtime need not be specified in MapReduce.configure(co.cask.cdap.api.mapreduce.MapReduceConfigurer)
    co.cask.cdap.api.mapreduce.MapReduceConfigurer.useDatasets(Iterable)
    datasets used in runtime need not be specified in MapReduce.configure(co.cask.cdap.api.mapreduce.MapReduceConfigurer)
    co.cask.cdap.api.worker.AbstractWorker.useDatasets(String, String...)
    datasets used in runtime need not be specified in Worker.configure(co.cask.cdap.api.worker.WorkerConfigurer)
    co.cask.cdap.api.mapreduce.AbstractMapReduce.useDatasets(String, String...)
    datasets used in runtime need not be specified in MapReduce.configure(co.cask.cdap.api.mapreduce.MapReduceConfigurer)
